page.title: 19The Wildlife of Hartwell.
page.content: There is a forest in Hartwell but it has decreased over the years.Still the wildlife flocks there and does well even though farming has ruined hedges by joining together small fields to make ploughing easier.Recently the motorway was repaired and soil and some concrete rubble was dumped all over part of the forest.We think this has killed quite alot of plants,trees and animals.The forest has red,fallow,roe & muntjac deer,rabbits,grey squirrel,fox, badger,owls and lots of woodland birds & butterflies.In the village there are house sparrows,house martins,starlings, swallows and swifts.There other common birds too but one is the collared dove which mews like a cat for its call. Melanie Harris,11 & Dawn Cadle,11.
